meanings.definition: To wait longer than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always outwaits her friends when they play hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent2: The patient cat outwaits the curious mouse every time.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl outwaits the noisy squirrel in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner outwaits their competitors with steady pacing.
meanings.sent5: The spider outwaits its prey with patience and precision.

meanings.definition: To endure longer than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He outwaits the cold winter by wearing warm clothes.
meanings.sent2: The old tree outwaits the harsh weather with its strong roots.
meanings.sent3: The little seed outwaits the hungry birds by staying hidden in the soil.
meanings.sent4: The determined ant outwaits the rain by seeking shelter underground.
meanings.sent5: The mountain outwaits the passing storms with its solid presence.
